Uses of Class
chess.ChessPiece

    • Uses of ChessPiece in chess

      Subclasses of ChessPiece in chess 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Bishop
      Bishop is the subclass of ChessPiece that houses the logic for bishops moving.
      class  King
      This is the king subclass of ChessPiece.
      class  Knight
      This is the Knight subclass of ChessPiece
      class  Pawn
      Pawn subclass of ChessPiece
      class  Queen
      The Queen subclass of ChessPiece
      class  Rook
      The Rook subclass of ClassPiece
      Fields in chess declared as ChessPiece 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) ChessPiece[][] ChessBoard.board
      The board which holds all the ChessPieces in the game, if there is no piece in a location it is set to null
      Methods in chess with parameters of type ChessPiece 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private boolean ChessBoard.canRemoveCheck(ChessPiece defender, int row, int col)
      canRemoveCheck cycles through all of a given pieces possible moves, and tests each one to see if it would remove check.
      boolean Rook.isValidMove(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol, ChessPiece[][] board)
      Rook isValidMove checks if the desired location is reachable by moving in the cardinal directions centered on the rook.
      boolean Queen.isValidMove(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol, ChessPiece[][] board)
      The Queen isValidMove function is a combination of the rook and bishop isValidMove checks.
      boolean Pawn.isValidMove(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol, ChessPiece[][] board)
      Pawn isValidMove does a few checks.
      boolean Knight.isValidMove(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol, ChessPiece[][] board)
      The knights isValidMove does not stop if enemy pieces are in its path, as the knight is allowed to hop over other pieces.
      boolean King.isValidMove(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol, ChessPiece[][] board)
      isValidMove in King is never used, but is declared to satisfy inheriting the abstract function
      abstract boolean ChessPiece.isValidMove(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol, ChessPiece[][] board)
      isValidMove is an abstract function to be overwritten by each child that inherits ChessPiece.
      boolean Bishop.isValidMove(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol, ChessPiece[][] board)
      isValidMove for bishop checks in what diagonal direction the piece is trying to move.
